reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We staded at Macia Condor for one night in April, during Semana Santa. The room was very comfortable, with a balcony (althought it was going out to the main street, where there were development works that time). Clean, simple and nice. The hotel is 4 stars. We made the order thought the hotels.spain-bookings.com.
reviews.title: Great room, bad restorant
Decent hotel but ...
reviews.text: There is a parking in the hotel, but I wouldn't recomend on using it. It's very small, only for maybe 4 cars, and very expencive (12 euro per night). Across the street there is a municipal parking for much less, and it's guarded, so you don't need to worry about your car, while you get to know Granada.

reviews.title: Very bad
reviews.text: The location is good. 1 minute walk, there is a bus stop for Alhambra. 5 minutes walk is The Catedrala. Behind the courner is internet-cafe.
The check in girl was very nice and helpful, she gave us a good directions and explaned about the Semana Santa proccesions. The next morning there was a young man, who was not so helpful.

reviews.title: Barely worth 3 stars
reviews.text: This hotel is definitely not four stars. The walls are so thin you can hear everything your neighbors are doing in the rooms next to you - even just conversations. The bathrooms have some type of open sewer line, which may just be the norm in this part of the city. The beds are horrible; you can feel the coils in your back. The a/c is inconsistent at best. Service is mediocre.

stayed here in sep 2004. i got a fantastic deal, 50 euro for a double room through orbitz. this is a 3 to 4 star hotel with typical amenities. only drawback is that it is a couple of bus stops from the al hambra hill. not a problem for me. i would stay here again if i got a similar discount.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located right in the old part of Granada 3 blocks from the center. Great pricing with breakfast and a little more for parking. Free wi-fi! Beautiful rooms and very clean with a wonderful and very friendly staff. We will stay there again!
reviews.title: BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCKS!!

reviews.text: I was only here for a couple of days, so did not spend a lot of time in the hotel. Our room was of a great size, and had complimentary bottles of Acqua Panna. The best thing about this hotel is its location! Just a couple of blocks from the main sites
reviews.title: Well located

reviews.text: I stayed at Macia Condor Hotel for approximately 1 week in January 2009. I really enjoyed my stay. The room was bright and comfortable, with windows that opened fully - I was able to bathe in the warm winter sunshine even while inside and to enjoy the sights and sounds of the bustling street below. I love to walk and so found the location terrific, within walking distance to all major tourist attractions, the University of Granada, and many excellent restaurants. I found the hotel staff to be extraordinarily patient with my attempts to communicate. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. It is clean, pleasant, and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Comfortable Accommodations in a Great Location

reviews.text: Our room was a bit small after they added a bed for our kid, but it was expected. And it only had a small window, but we didn't need to spend much time in it, anyway. It was clean, everything working perfectly. The staff was extremely helpful, spoke perfect English when our Spanish failed us. They assisted in making reservations to local events/sites. They also offered a very helpful local tourist map, which we used extensively. The included breakfast was a real treat, fresh, with great variety of offerings and helpful staff keeping everything running. We didn't use the restaurant for other meals, but stopped for a beer the first night before hitting the sack (tip: the local beer is superb!) Granada is a wonderful city and the hotel is located within walk distance of everything you want to see and experience. That's a big plus, because the best of Granada cannot be seen by car. One complaint: the hotel could use a couple more computers in the lobby for guests to use, especially in a hotel with so many youngsters... But the young'ins were always well-behaved and ready to surrender the single computer to guests who needed it.
reviews.title: Great location, clean rooms, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room wasn't too bad but we were very disappointed with the breakfast. The cereals were damp and the 'hot' food was very cold even when the restaurant first opened and coffee was undrinkable. I would not go back there, especially as it's supposed to be 4 star.
reviews.title: Disappointed
